intro: Neonauclea subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved neonauclea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruits are dry capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Neonauclea subsessilis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky outcrops.
